resources.name: 211 Maryland (Main Resource Line)
resources.address: 9770 Patuxent Woods Dr Suite 334, Columbia, MD 21046
resources.description: 24/7 Information and Referral System connecting veterans to community resources including housing, employment, benefits, food, and healthcare services

resources.name: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.description: Local Service Officers helping veterans and eligible dependents obtain VA benefits

resources.name: Maryland's Commitment to Veterans (MCV)
resources.description: Provides crisis intervention, emergency services, substance misuse treatment, behavioral health support, peer support, and suicide prevention

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 confidential crisis support for veterans in suicidal crisis or emotional distress

resources.name: Combat Call Line
resources.description: Combat veterans and family members answering phone lines to discuss military concerns and civilian life adjustment

resources.name: Caregiver Support Line
resources.description: Support services for family members caring for veterans

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: 24/7/365 trained responders connecting homeless veterans to resources and VA programs

resources.name: National Coalition for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: Provides information and connects veterans to local community organizations for housing and homelessness services

resources.name: Maryland Center for Veterans Education and Training (MCVET)
resources.description: Provides day drop-in facilities, case management during first 60 days, recovery classes, counseling, and VA benefits assistance

resources.name: MD HOPE Hotline
resources.description: Mortgage assistance and foreclosure prevention counseling for homeowners

resources.name: VA Maryland Health Care System
resources.address: Baltimore, Perry Point, Loch Raven (Central Maryland/Eastern Shore)
resources.description: VA medical center providing inpatient care, emergency services, outpatient care, mental health, preventive care, and prescription medications

resources.name: Martinsburg VA Medical Center
resources.description: VA medical center serving Western Maryland veterans with comprehensive healthcare services

resources.name: Washington DC VA Medical Center
resources.address: Washington, DC (serves Montgomery & Prince George's Counties and Southern Maryland)
resources.description: VA medical center serving DC metro area veterans

resources.name: Sheppard Pratt Suicide Prevention Program
resources.description: Mental health screenings, clinical emergency treatment, case management, and VA benefit assistance

resources.name: Veterans Affairs Employment Programs
resources.description: Homeless Veterans Community Employment Services (HVCES), Compensated Work Therapy (CWT), and Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment (VR&E) programs

resources.name: Maryland American Job Centers
resources.description: Career counseling, job search assistance, training programs, and referrals specifically for transitioning veterans

resources.name: Maryland Workforce Exchange (MWE)
resources.description: Online job-seeking resource for all job seekers including unemployed veterans filing for benefits

resources.name: State of Maryland Veterans Jobs
resources.description: State government positions with military background preferences for veterans

resources.name: Maryland Veterans Trust Fund
resources.description: Provides grants and loans to struggling veterans with goal of achieving self-sufficiency

resources.name: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) - Unmet Needs
resources.description: Grants up to $1,500 for basic life needs including rent, mortgage, utilities, and medical care with no repayment required

resources.name: American Legion - Temporary Financial Assistance
resources.description: Temporary financial assistance for minor children of active duty and Legion members for shelter, food, utilities, and health expenses

resources.name: Operation Homefront - Critical Financial Assistance
resources.description: Critical financial assistance for eligible service members and veterans

resources.name: Army Emergency Relief
resources.description: Interest-free loans and grants for Army veterans and active duty for unforeseen emergencies

resources.name: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society
resources.description: Interest-free loans and grants for Navy and Marine Corps veterans for emergency assistance

resources.name: Coast Guard Mutual Assistance
resources.description: Interest-free loans and grants for Coast Guard veterans for emergency assistance

resources.name: Air Force Emergency Assistance
resources.description: Interest-free loans and grants for Air Force veterans for emergency assistance

resources.name: Armed Forces Foundation
resources.description: Emergency assistance for service members and veterans across all branches

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: Support services for wounded, ill, and injured veterans

resources.name: Military OneSource
resources.description: Individualized consultations, coaching, and non-medical counseling for tax services, money management, parenting

resources.name: American Red Cross Military Families
resources.description: Services and support for military families and veterans

resources.name: Federal VA Benefits Office
resources.description: Central hub for VA benefits information and applications

resources.name: VA Veteran Centers
resources.description: Free readjustment counseling, family and group counseling, sexual trauma counseling, and PTSD services (bring DD214)

resources.name: Maryland Legal Aid
resources.description: Free legal clinics and offices serving 15 counties with low-cost or free legal services

resources.name: Pro Bono Resource Center of Maryland
resources.description: Legal help and pro bono services for eligible individuals

resources.name: MD Housing Search Locator
resources.description: Online resource for finding affordable housing options
